title: JS doesn't like "%" as the first char in a property name, this probably ...
body: ...needs to be expanded to catch other invalid characters.

title: Improve readability
body: Improvements to readability at the cost of a few bytes

title: Add note about running the tests
Don't block click events entirely on touch devices.
body: This preventDefault call prevents the click event from firing at all.

title: Expose d3_selection_enterPrototype for better extensibility
Generalize gravity to a field in force layout
body:
This can be a flexible tool for certain effects. In my case, it is
having a single element in the centre (achieved with `e.fixed = 1`),
whilst everybody else tries to be a bit far away, but not too far away.
So, I have a moat field where there is centrifugal force if you are more
than R away from centre, and centripetal force if you are less than R.

As a special case (and the default), this is the traditional gravity
field.

Implementation is simple too.

title: Fix bugs relating to inheritance of built-in object prototype properties.
body:
You'll love this one!

I've been over-cautious here, so you may not care about all of these cases.  The main one is data joins; I think that's a real issue, especially on Firefox where the `"watch" in {} === true`.

The only case I didn't think worth bothering with was d3_geo_type.

title: Support HSV colors
body: This branch adds support for HSV colors. I implemented most of the API of HSL. What's not implemented (If it's desired), can easily be implemented by converting the HSV to HSL, doing the computation, and converting back.

title: V2.8.0
body: Staging branch for v2.8.0.

title: Initial touch support for d3.svg.brush.
body:
This is just the single-touch version. Multitouch might be nice as a way to simulate the alt+drag behaviour available in the mouse version.

Fixes #418.

title: Prevent next tick when force.stop is called.
body: This is useful when stopping the layout in response to a user action, e.g. if another layout is used to position the nodes in an event handler.  In this case, we don't want the next tick of the force layout to run as it could undo the positioning work done in the event handler.

title: Add PivotGraph (rollup) layout example.
body: This is ported from the Protovis implementation, [pv.Layout.Rollup](http://mbostock.github.com/protovis/jsdoc/symbols/pv.Layout.Rollup.html). The only difference is that the rollup nodes are not instances of any original nodes (Protovis used pv.extend).  Users are expected to use the "x" and "y" properties of the rollup node, or alternatively the "rolled up" nodes can be retrieved via the "nodes" property.

title: Add "resume" and "stop" events to the force-directed layout
body:
The motivation for this patch is to allow for a layout to hide the "whizzing and zooming" part of the process and only render the network once it is stable.

Note that "start" isn't implemented since it is functionally identical to "resume".

title: Decorative brush resizers + touch support.
body:
The brush component now allows you to add decorative elements to serve as brush
resizers, while keeping the default behavior of a few invisible pixels on the
edge of the extent. Any element you add to ".resize" containers can serve as
visible handles for the brush.

This commit also fixes two small bugs with the brush component. First, we now
track the offset between the extent edge and the mouse, rather than immediately
jumping the extent edge to the mouse position; this was barely noticeable
previously due to the resizers being so thin, but it is very noticeable with
large resizers. Second, the default behavior for the SPACE key is not prevented
whilst dragging.

title: Add constrained centre zoom example.
body: Better version of #504.

title: Add zoom translate extent example (mercator).
body: Just to show it can be done. :)

title: Continuous integration tracking with Travis
body:
It would be neat to have the automated tests run on d3, and tracking over time of how they fare. Travis provides this for free, and I just went through the easy http://about.travis-ci.org/docs/user/getting-started/ guide to try setting it up for my d3 fork. My output from the two last test commits is here (and this view is also the main feature I personally seek): http://travis-ci.org/#!/johan/d3/builds …which also showed up like this in the Freenode IRC channel #d3-travis I noted for live notifications of the build bots: 
09:09 travis-ci has joined (~travis-ci@ec2-174-129-114-189.compute-1.amazonaws.com)
09:09 travis-ci: [travis-ci] johan/d3#1 (master - 1db25aa : Johan Sundström): The build passed.
09:09 travis-ci: [travis-ci] Change view : https://github.com/johan/d3/compare/d86074b...1db25aa
09:09 travis-ci: [travis-ci] Build details : http://travis-ci.org/johan/d3/builds/675203
09:09 travis-ci has left ()
09:17 travis-ci has joined (~travis-ci@ec2-174-129-114-189.compute-1.amazonaws.com)
09:17 travis-ci: [travis-ci] johan/d3#2 (master - 3f5c60d : Johan Sundström): The build was broken.
09:17 travis-ci: [travis-ci] Change view : https://github.com/johan/d3/compare/1db25aa...3f5c60d
09:17 travis-ci: [travis-ci] Build details : http://travis-ci.org/johan/d3/builds/675220
09:17 travis-ci has left ()
...and like this, in the build hook emails I tested (all notification setup is in .travis.yml): http://mailinator.com/maildir.jsp?email=d3-travis It might of course be worth turning off testing on node.js 0.7 (I tried it to see how it fared) and perhaps tweak other Travis config flags as per http://about.travis-ci.org/docs/user/build-configuration/ at your discretion. :-)

title: Define behavior for mismatched domain & range.
Minor tweaks.
body: Unimportant tweaks: typos in comments, simplifications to examples, removal of extraneous semicolon.

title: Add index.js for easier usage within Node.
body:
This allows you to require("d3") with no additional dependencies, and without
polluting the global namespace. Fixes #475.

title: Add new '%s' format to d3.time.format for the ordinal date suffix.
body:
This change adds a new `%s` format to d3.time.format which prints the English ordinal suffix of the formatted date.

For example, `d3.time.format("%b %e%s")` used to format 01 Jan 1990 would output `Jan  1st`.

title: IEEE 754 range() error
body:
`range()` was causing an error because of IEEE 754 arithmetic. For example:

``` javascript
d3.range(0.2, 0.4, 0.1) === [0.2, 0.30000000000000004]
```

So I've implemented a simple fix by converting any floats to integers, then converting back after the arithmetic is complete. Also included is an additional test case to test for this condition.

title: Make the "auto-scaling" time formats use 24-hour hours
body: I'm not sure if it's worth making this an option; but if it's not then 24-hours really are more universally useful than 12-hours + am/pm.  :-)

title: Rewrite of d3.behavior.zoom.
body:
The extent functionality is simplified, such that the zoom behavior only
supports an extent on the scale factor. Furthermore, the extent is expressed as
a scale factor rather than a zoom level, for consistency. An extent on translate
is no longer supported; this isn't possible unless the zoom behavior also knows
the size of the canvas.

The scale transform functionality is also simplified; simply register an x or y
scale, and the zoom behavior will automatically update the domain before a zoom
event is dispatched. If you change the scale's domain programmatically, you can
simply reassign the scale to the zoom behavior.

Both of these changes are strictly backwards-incompatible. However, since this
class is undocumented, I'll probably let this slide with a minor version bump
rather than waiting until v3.

This commit also reduces the scroll speed slightly, since the previous
implementation seemed a little too fast for my liking. It would be easy to make
the scroll speed configurable as a future enhancement.

Implementation note: rather than using global event listeners on the window, and
needing to copy local state into globals on interaction start, the zoom behavior
now uses closures that are temporarily bound (e.g., mousemove and mouseup are
bound on mousedown, and removed on mouseup).

Fixes #484, allowing scale and translate to be get or set externally.
Fixes #485, providing an example of integration with d3.geo.projection.
Fixes #487, using a scale extent rather than a zoom-level extent.

title: Fix polygon.centroid for open polygons.
body:
The implementation assumed closed polygons, but it should work on either. This
is a partial fix for #443.

title: Minimize d3.interpolateTransform.
body: Fixes #480.
